subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Someone sent this to me---From Bruce's Yahoo group---HE'S A...
author: SnowfireL@aol.com
full_text:
-------------------------------1249063054
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

I'm not going into this LK, but they were both hollering at each other,  
Bruce should not have worded it that way, he was probably still upset, people  
say things they don't mean all the time, think about it.  And just because  
people say things they don't mean it does not make it so. SF
 
 
In a message dated 7/31/2009 1:53:42 P.M. Eastern Daylight Time,  
itcnap@... writes:

 
 
 
Snow, Let me get this right....you say this? I don't think he meant this  
to slight you anyway,....

re-read the nasty rantings of an idiot,  that begged for FS's Boxes and got 
them and claimed he was an EXPERT and  GOD!!
for crimney sakes, that's not balanced, and normal!! 
And the lies  he spews, like he says....#12 was stolen from me by a low 
life that took  
> advantage of my generosity. That's a lie, he gave it to her!!!!  we all 
were in the conversation and he admitted he gave it to her!!  Oh  and how 
about the times he said he was gonna put a FS Box on Ebay for 500.00  
bucks...geez. Oh  and
Like I said......time to ignore this guy and  move on!

LK





--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogr--- In E
>
> I did not send this to you Frank, I  do NOT spread rumors, and it was not 
> right for someone to be so cruel  to to send this to you. So shame on 
that 
> person whomever it was, I  think we owe this research to you, and to 
other's 
> in the field, like  a man called Meek from the 60's, he did lots of 
research, 
> we would  not be able to know how to do this if not for you guys. This 
> stops  here, I don't think he meant this to slight you anyway, I would 
have 
>  loved to have one of your box', people that spred rumors have a problem. 
 sf
> 
> 
> In a message dated 7/31/2009 12:30:06 P.M.  Eastern Daylight Time, 
> purplealiengirl@ purplealie
>  
> 
> 
> 
> Just FYI--I'm not like these other clowns,  proclaiming how great I am! 
> I've said over and over I know the older  boxes are just shift, and 
should be 
> thrown away. I also stated I'm no  engineer, and it takes me a long time 
to 
> figure this stuff out, and  it seems, few if anyone else can get this 
stuff 
> to work at all. I  don't sell the stuff, no one is out money, except for 
> postage. I made  no claims about how great my boxes are. 
> 
> Holiday cuts and  pastes words together to form impressive sounding 
> messages, then  proclaims how great he is, and that's all this crap is, 
cutting 
>  someone else down for his own benefit. The guy produces nothing on his 
own,  
> and can't even spell radio, let alone make one! How dare you  (holiday) 
cut me 
> down!? Talk about frig gin' slander! 
>  
> The world is full is these scum bags all proclaiming how righteous,  how 
> conservative, how--whatever, <WBR>the dark side is  everywhere! But what 
> really makes it bad is the morons that hang on  every word from these 
show cl 
> That 'S why I say I can't really take  offense, like they say, consider 
the 
> source. 
> 
> So  where's my incentive to continue this work? Think I've spend enough 
>  endless night in the basement!
> 
> 
> 
>  Frank-S
> 
> 
> Forwarded conversation
> Subject:  Someone sent this to me---From Bruce's Yahoo group---HE'S AN 
> IDIOT  !!!!
> ------------ -------- --
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> Bonnie,
> 
> The small 20-125 you have  is light years ahead of the Frank's box in the 
> quality of  communication it allows you to receive. I have had the two 
> Frank's  box #'S 12 and 29. #12 was stolen from me by a low life that 
took 
>  advantage of my generosity. That is another story.
> I still have  Frank's box #29, the reason you never hear files from me 
> using that  box is because it literally "Sucks!"
> 
> Most if not all Frank's  box is inherently filled with static white noise 
> and that combined  with a metal echo box and noise generator makes it 
very 
> difficult to  hear anything let alone communication which is difficult 
enough 
> to  hear from a quiet box likes the 125.
> 
> Frank's box has seen  it's day and s erved it's purpose in my opinion it 
is 
> antiquated and  is no where near the quality of even a small cheap RS 
12-469 
> as far  as clarity of communication.
> 
> Frank is actually using the guts  from RS hacks to build his boxes now so 
> why have a "FRANKENBOX" that  is essentially an RS hack with noise added 
> instead of just buying an  RS box and getting better communication? 
> 
> Mind you this  is only my opinion but it is based on years of experience 
> with every  box that is or has been used. I currently have 14 different 
boxes 
> not  to mention EVP maker and I have done extensive sessions and research 
>  with each and for my money you can give me a 20-125 every time, the 
Frank's  
> box should be retired to the box museum where it belongs.
>  
> I am the only person in this research that will come out and speak  the 
> truth about the Frank's box, there are many people now that have  them 
and the 
> only person you will ever hear a file from is Steve Hula  and sometimes 
> Frank himself, and Frank's file is so rough you may  hear 1 out of a 
hundred 
> files the way he does due to the fact that he  does not even take the 
time to 
> do a proper session he just turns the  box on and records a couple of 
minute 
> using his CELL PHONE !
>  
> Frank has his place in RTSC history due to his ALLEGED invention off  the 
> first ghost box and he deserves the respect for his "POSSIBLE"  
> accomplishment but to be revered as a god in the box field NO not by  me 
anyway.
> 
> I use the words "ALLEGED" and "POSSIBLE" in terms  of his being the first 
> to create the ghost box due to some recent  information that has been 
brought 
> to my attention that concerns an  individual that created, built and used 
A 
> Radio Sweeping Ghost Box in  1969.
> 
> I am gathering information and documentation now and  will hopefully be 
> ; able to dispel the myth of Frank assumption being  the father of the 
ghost Box 
> soon.
> 
> That is to be  continued! 
> 
> 
> 
> All is possible, nothing is  probable
> 
> Bruce
> 
>
